[Staurodidache kai stauronike] The doctrine & dominion of the crosse : in an historical narration and spiritual application of the passion of Iesus. / Written first in Latin by John Ferus ... ; now turned into English for the good of this nation by Henry Pinnell. ; Together with a preface of the translator, containing the necessity of knowing and conforming unto the cross of Christ, short considerations of predestination, redemption, free will and original sin. Ferus, Johann, 1495-1554. Pinnell, Henry.
[50], 419 p.
Printed by Robert White, London : 1659.
Title transliterated from Greek characters. Reproduction of original in: Dulwich College Library.
=======
[Staurodidache kai stauronike] The doctrine & dominion of the crosse : in an historical narration and spiritual application of the passion of Iesus. / Written first in Latin by John Ferus ... ; now turned into English for the good of this nation by Henry Pinnell. ; Together with a preface of the translator, containing the necessity of knowing and conforming unto the cross of Christ, short considerations of predestination, redemption, free will and original sin. Ferus, Johann, 1495-1554. Pinnell, Henry.
[50], 419 p.
Printed by Robert White, London : 1659.
Title transliterated from Greek characters. Reproduction of original in: Dulwich College Library.
Robert White
